benchmark_details.name: RealCBT (Real Cognitive Behavioral Therapy Dataset)
benchmark_details.overview: RealCBT is a dataset of authentic cognitive behavioral therapy dialogues collected from public video-sharing platforms. It allows for a comparative analysis of emotional arcs between real and LLM-generated therapy sessions, highlighting the emotional dynamics that characterize these interactions.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To establish an empirical benchmark for comparing emotional dynamics in real vs. synthetic therapy dialogues.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: RealCBT is limited in size and exhibits subgroup imbalance due to the difficulties in collecting authentic therapy dialogues.

data.source: Collected from public video-sharing platforms, specifically CBT-based counseling sessions.
data.annotation: Manual transcription and automated annotation of metadata using language models.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are computed from sequences of utterances using NRC Valence, Arousal, and Dominance (VAD) Lexicon.
methodology.interpretation: Higher values in emotional metrics indicate greater emotional engagement, variability, and recovery.
methodology.baseline_results: Comparative analysis primarily against synthetic dialogues from the CACTUS dataset.
methodology.validation: Systematic statistical analysis using the Mannâ€“Whitney U test to confirm significance.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The dataset reflects demographic patterns relating to client gender and therapist-client interactions.
targeted_risks.harm: The synthesis of therapy dialogues could mislead users regarding the emotional fidelity of synthetic conversations.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Data collected from public domains ensuring no personal identifiers were included.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: All data sourced from publicly accessible content.
